contest-event.event-date: Sept. 26, 1903 D National Championship of Great Britain (Crystal Palace) National Championship of Great Britain (Championship Section Final) 1 Test Piece Contest National Championship of Great Britain (Finals) national-finals-championship-section European Championships The current Nationals contest began in 1900, but there was a previous 'Nationals' contest run 40 years earlier: Enderby Jackson's Great National Contest. Championship Die Meistersinger Crystal Palace (Concert Hall), Crystal Palace Park, Sydenham, County of London, England, UK Prizes: 1st: 40 Pounds plus 1000 Guinea Trophy (Total prize valued at £1,132) 2nd: 30 Pounds plus 4 valve euphonium 3rd: 20 Pounds plus cornet 4th: 18 Pounds plus 'Coortois' trombone 5th: 16 Pounds plus 40 numbers of music valued at 10 guineas 6th: 12 Pounds plus 'Soloist' trombone 7th: 10 Pounds plus 'Rex' model cornet 8th: Slide trombone valued at 9 guineas 9th: 24 Bandsmen's caps valued at £9 10th: 24 Bandsmen's caps valued at £9 11th: 24 Shoulder belts valued at 12 guineas 12th: 'Diaphonie' tenor horn valued at 9 guineas June 1, 2011, 12:50 p.m. Feb. 16, 2014, 9:28 p.m. 1 Besses o' th' Barn Alexander Owen 2 Rushden Windmill Band Alexander Owen 3 Black Dyke Band John Gladney Jnr 4 Wingates Band William Rimmer 5 Pemberton Old Wigan DW Band John Gladney Jnr 6 Cleckheaton Victoria Angus Holden 7 Luton Band Angus Holden 8 Kingston Mills Band Alexander Owen 9 Linthwaite Silver Band Edwin Swift 10 Tillery Collieries Band John Griffiths 11 Standish Band William Rimmer 12 Wyke Edwin Swift 13 Lee Mount Alexander Owen 14 Cleveland Steel Works William Holdsworth 15 Kettering Town Silver Band Randolph Ryan 16 Rotherham Borough Alexander Owen 17 Halifax King Cross John Gladney Jnr 18 Kettering Rifles Alexander Owen
